body: You can learn to draw anything, you have to do both theory (studying) and practice. First you have to learn basic facial and body anatomy, which doesn't take more than 1 hour, then you can practice and learn more deeper into anatomy, colour theory, shading, etc. You can watch a lot of tutorials on youtube, normally people recommend reading andrew loomis books for starters. google yourself the book recommendations.

body: I don't know one guy who can draw more than a stick figure, and yes many of them have done it for a really long time. While I know tons of girls who have amazing skill within a year or two of starting, in fact I'd say almost all of them do. And I've never ever heard anyone have any experience different from this, it's always the same pattern. And it's actually proven that men can't see color nearly as good as women can. And most other activities are the same way, excluding sports, physical labor, and competition (men are more competitive because that's how they get the most resources and impress the ladies). You just see more male artists on the market because they're expected to be the breadwinners and capitalize on their skill. Women are more likely to do things purely for fun in private.

body:
> a non color blind man can see colors just as well as a woman can

No, men legit have less cones and more rods. Male eyes are designed to sense motion more easily while female ones are made to see an aesthetically pleasing environment. The usual sacrifice men make in everything, they give up what's happy to become stronger and better at physical labor and war and sex. This is why women are so much better at coloring things, because men can't distinguish between similar shades.

> Women also have an easier time in school since it's built around them.

School was actually built for boys initially, girls are just more productive and attentive in general. Boys have trouble concentrating because their bodies are made to zone out into a rest state in anticipation of upcoming labor. A NORMAL boy is the same as a girl with severe ADHD from what I've seen. Brainpower takes up energy, and men can't afford to waste it when they're meant for physical tasks. Men have more trouble than women in independent pursuits as well.
